results.title: The Big island [Cinemascope print]
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The aim of this film is to show an international audience within a limited time span some attractive aspects of Australian life. Representing Australia as a brisk and exciting place and creating a mood of a young country on the mood. Cinematography by Keith Gow and Don McAlpine. Music by George Dreyfus. (Awards: AFI Travel Award 1970)

results.title: The Big if
results.creator_credit: Brent Walker Film Productions, Peter Hollander, Kamil Pixa, United Nations and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: An animated satire questioning what our money might be able to be used for if it was not spent on defence weapons. Animated by Boris Masnik.

results.title: The Big hit [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Che-Kirk Wong, Wesley Snipes, Warren Zide and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Mark Wahlberg stars as an anxiety ridden killer for hire who is part of an elite team of hitmen (made up of Lou Diamond Philips, Antonio Sabato Jr. and Bokeem Woodbine) in this violent action comedy. Wahlberg’s chaotic domestic life and stressful blood soaked professional life come unstuck when the kidnapping of a wealthy businessman’s daughter has major repercussions for the band of killers. From its fetishistic reconstruction of the code and conduct of organized crime, right down to its casual, flippant depictions of violence, “The Big hit” owes a lot to the films of Quentin Tarantino (which are in themselves pastiches of various European and American filmmakers). However the spectre of the Hong Kong action film hangs over them all (“The Big hit” goes as far as enlisting Hong Kong action director Che-Kirk Wong and the executive producer is the legendary John Woo), a cinema that is wonderfully inventive with its own form of genre splicing and indirect homage. Cast also includes Christina Applegate, Elliot Gould, Laine Kazan and Avery Brooks.

results.title: The Big gull: Karoro: New Zealand's black-backed gull
results.creator_credit: Grant Foster, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: The New Zealand black-backed gull is one of 44 species that has adapted its natural way of life, to benefit from the wasteful habits of man. With naturalist Sir Robert Falla.

results.title: The Big green disc
results.creator_credit: Charlie Hemming, Phillip Nash and Media Design Interactive
results.brief_description: An interactive documentary, this CD-ROM looks at the future of our planet through a discussion of the environmental issues threatening it and what every person can do to help. Problems investigated include; global warming, pollution, ozone layer depletion, acid rain and the potential solutions: recycling, alternative energy sources and conservation. After examining the issues, you can enter into the debate, hearing what the world’s experts have to say about the issues affecting us all. This beautifully composed CD-ROM is fully narrated with stunning photography throughout, it includes specially filmed video sequences, in-depth photo stories and animated diagrams, including graphs to illustrate relevant points. Also included is a full index of contact addresses for all the relevant environmental organisations in Europe and America. A very useful and interesting means of learning how we can all help to save our home, which would suit secondary school aged children and adults alike!

results.title: The Big green caterpillar. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Uses close-up photography to show the development of the caterpillar from the egg to the pupa and then to the butterfly stage. Narrated by Jill Taggart. Suitable for primary years prep-6.

results.title: The Big fellow
results.creator_credit: Michel Pearce, Kip Porteous and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Reconstructs the political career of J.T. Lang, Premier of New South Wales in 1925-1927 and 1930-1932, using contemporary film and stills and the recollections of some of the people most involved. Narrated by Allan Fraser. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Big easy
results.creator_credit: Jim McBride, Stephen J. Friedman and Kings Road Entertainment
results.brief_description: The Big Easy is a sexy thriller romance set in New Orleans. When a member of the mafia is murdered in downtown New Orleans, Remy McSwain (Dennis Quaid) and Anne Osborne (Ellen Barkin) are unwittingly forced together as they pursue the murderer who may or may not be a cop. Barkin’s starchy D.A. prosecutor disapproves of the shady ethical practises of McSwain and his ‘Big Easy’ co-workers, who view bribery as a normal way of life. Remy McSwain, who comes from a large family of New Orleans policemen starts to reevaluate his values and life as he and Osborne become closer. Jim McBride has created a rivetting and fun film which revels in it’s complex characters and in the sizzling chemistry between Dennis Quaid and Ellen Barkin. Ned Beatty and Charles Ludlam are good in supporting roles and the film pulses with great cajun music and a sense of life in New Orleans.

results.title: The Big deal on Maddona Street = I soliti ignoto = Persons unknown = The usual unidentified thieves
results.creator_credit: Mario Monicelli, Franco Cristaldi and Lux Film
results.brief_description: This now classic Italian spoof on the caper film, about a group of incompetent amateur crooks who plan an elaborate but misguided robbery on a store, was hugely successful in both Italy and the United States. Primarily a take-off of Dassian’s ‘Rififi’ (1955), its comedy of errors is firmly rooted in social conditions of deprivation. Moncelli uses the conventions of the heist film to maximum effect and adds a steady stream of sight gags played out by an impeccable cast featuring Vittorio Gassman, Renato Salvatori, Claudia Cardinale and Marcello Mastroianni, with hilarious results. The jazz score by Piero Umiliani is also notable. From a story by Age Scarpelli. Credits: Director, Mario Monicelli ; writers, Age Scarpelli, Suso Cecchi D’amico, Mario Monicelli ; photography, Erico Menczer ; music, Piero Umiliani. Nominated for an Oscar for Best Foreign Film in 1958.
